messages.content: Oops
@Scott
Hello
Break room. Thatâ€™s gold!
Image
Hmm he was supposed to be looking happy
Looks more like something from Wolf Creek
Yeah he was supposed to just be enjoying lunch...
He's just pissed off all the time lol
When he looks happy he looks like mickey mouse
Here we go, I spiked his drink Image
Actually no that's this one Image
With each iteration, the piss filter gets more intense
If this isn't fixed in image 1.5, OAI will get pissed on all over again by niche image people
pissing faster won't satisfy them
I honestly don't care, I don't use image gen much. I just find the coined term "piss filter" to be hilarious
And it's funny when you see something used in a professional instance that you can instantly recognise as being generated by OAI
It's also known as the "set in Mexico" filter ðŸ˜‚
Given I did use that image as a source image for each iteration, yeah the piss filter was applied to each
yeah that's when it becomes increasingly noticeable, with iterative edits
Mexico filter, I'll assume there's no correlation there lol
Tried to change the colour temperature, now it looks like he's in a fridge Image
Just can't win, but it seems more fitting to the scene
mhm, tell GPT-5 to prompt the image model using markdown listing top priority things at the top and lower level detail at the bottom. That might make your images come out better.
This lead me to believe you think it's possibly a front-end problem once again lol
As when GPT front end is giving instructions to the Image model, it must keep instructing it to add a warm colour temperature lol
well I don't know if im colour blind or not so does this have the 'piss filter'? Image
Nah that's fine
so yeah the issues front end haha
fuck
It's not something that happens every time.
Just more than it should, and it gets worse with iterative edits

Mhm have to give it a try with what i said and let me know if it appears but I am sure its the way gpt-5 is prompting the image model shame can't see the prompt unless you ask it and even the it hallucinates and lies lol I see some yellow but seems right for the image Image
I tried edited it directly with GPT-image-1 Image
lmfao
It's a very subtle thing. And perhaps less likely in certain cases. It mainly becomes obvious after about 3-4 edits, like if it got some text wrong and you ask it to correct it etc
I see there's an option for quality and high fidelity, perhaps the chatgpt front end goes for the cheapest? Image

I've just laughed when I've seen it used in advertising. Like some ad agency charged a client a premium for creating an ad campaign, and the end product that goes to market is something they clearly just iterated on multiple times using gpt-image
Well this is bullshit Image
I should submit a support request ðŸ˜‚
Those bloody cunts and their guardrails ... @Sato ðŸ‘€
WOKE

What was it @Sato you were saying about don't gaslight AIs? Although the bastard is now gaslighting me! Image Image

Yeah utter BS!
